p: The new method tends to be better able to correctly identify the “true” model from pseudo-observations ( Fig 5, Fig M in S1 File). This is not surprising since it uses extra variability information that is not available to the “trend” method. This extra information can provide a powerful constraint because models differ considerably in their representation of internal variability, based on sample estimates of the variability properties ( Fig 4). The most striking improvement is obtained for the AMOC experiment while arguably the least improvement–for the AMOCIndex (Fig M in S1 File).
